programme.title: Sports Life
programme.sub-title: One Chess Move Ahead: A Daughter's Fight for Her Father

programme.title: Tomorrow Today

programme.desc: Detailed explanations, competent analysis, coverage of world current affairs: politics, business, sport and culture. Fascinating insights beyond the headlines. Connecting the dots for viewers around the world.

programme.title: Afrimaxx
programme.sub-title: On Being Bold, Proud And African
programme.desc: Celebrating bold African artistry. From optical illusions with host Meling Balloo in Mauritius to coffee culture with Esther Atieno in Kenya. In Nigeria, the Loud Urban Choir is redefining choral music.

programme.title: Under the Baobab
programme.sub-title: Is Zimbabwe Under Political Siege?
programme.desc: Eight years after Mugabe's fall, Mnangagwa's Zimbabwe is haunted by repression, fear, and division. Is the opposition failing, or is the ruling party too ruthless to be challenged?

programme.title: REV
programme.sub-title: Malta's Heritage on Wheels: The Fight to Save Its Buses
programme.desc: Malta's hand-painted buses, each one unique, once ferried locals and tourists alike. Now few remain, lovingly restored by specialist coachbuilders. We also ride with police on speed patrol and test the VinFast VF 6.

programme.title: DocFilm
programme.sub-title: The Third Reich In The Dock - The First Nuremburg Trial, Part 1

programme.title: The 77 Percent
programme.sub-title: Long Street Debate: South Africa USAID Pullback
programme.desc: Could Africa's greatest opportunity come from a funding crisis? As USAID pulls back, the stage is set for a high-stakes debate at the Human Rights Festival. Young minds discuss whether the continent will become less dependent on American aid funding.

programme.desc: Local and global news broadcast from Germany. Including current affairs, weather, sports, international events, political news, entertainment, environmental and technological advancements.
